Articles.Content:
Another space program is in competition with you. There'd be a spaceflight history museum where you can view the flight logs of previous crafts, and learn about the Other Space Program's progress. You lose reputation if you begin failing against the Other Space Program. This would be a gamemode option (Sandbox, Career, Science, Competitive, and Multiplayer). The government would also become an agent for contracts, filling some of the roles of the Kerbin World First Record Keeping Society. They might even assign a mission for you to destroy a station or base of the Other Space Program.

Option 1

Here's where the Asteroid/StrandedKerbal system comes in. The ships from the Other Space Program would be generated in orbit or on the ground. You'd hear about the missions in advance before they happen so you can retaliate.

The Other Space Program would also respond to your missions. If you fly-by the Mun, they'll attempt a Minmus flyby or Mun landing.

Option 2

When multiplayer gets implemented, the Competitive Space Program would be operated by an A.I. and run on in the background. The A.I. would need to be complex so it can both succeed and fail. Problem is that if it's being calculated on your own computer you have to take account for extra parts being loaded while the A.I. is controlling it.

really? no response? wow.

Anyway, The museum would also have to be implemented for this to work. it'd be a room where you can place parts and over time people would come and spend money.
